South Africa can now strip refugees of their asylum status if they engage in any political activity related to their home countries, in a deeply ironic move after the ruling party and its people fought the apartheid regime for years as refugees in exile
https://www.latimes.com/world-nation/story/2020-01-14/south-africa-to-strip-refugees-status-for-any-political-act¬†‚Ä¶

Asked the First Minister, Mark Drakeford, about child protection. He claimed the question is not "relevant" because it wasn't about child refugees. One of the most dangerous situations a refugee can be put into is being grouped together with the same people they're running away from. In many cases, in Europe - many #ExMuslim refugees are grouped together with muslims from the same countries, in hopes they would find support.

The people of Sudan led a key political transition, creating opportunities to solve forced displacement.

A better future for millions of internally displaced, refugees from the region and Sudanese refugees in the region is possible but won‚Äôt happen without international support. pic.twitter.com/9s5eWHFnXv
